results.title: India: A Personal Encounter
results.creator_credit: Michael Dillon Film Enterprises and Michael Dillon
results.brief_description: Sir Edmund Hillary and friends journey from the ocean at India’s southernmost tip to the snows of Himalayas, a pilgrimage similar to those taken by millions of Hindus each year. Travelling by such unconventional means as canal boat, camel, elephant and bullock cart as well as by foot, bicycle, train and an old river sailboat, they were able to see the real India, through the tropical backwaters of Kerala, the deserts of Rajasthan, along the Ganges and into the Himalayas. They saw snake boat races, a heart-stopping martial arts display with flexible swords, a gathering of 10,000 camels, an ancient fort city in the Thar desert and much, much more. A stunningly photographed record of the remarkable sights and experiences of this remarkable journey - an enthralling family adventure.

results.title: India, Pakistan and the Union of India
results.brief_description: An account of the geography and sociological conditions existing in present-day India: Hindu and Muslim religions; important economic problems as experienced by a typical peasant family; industry in India; climatic conditions - a period of drought followed by the monsoon season; the spread of education and its effect on the industrial and agricultural life of the country.

results.title: India welcomes the Queen, 1961
results.creator_credit: British Movietone News and Commonwealth Relations Office
results.brief_description: H.M. the Queen’s tour of India, 1961. Episodes include the Royal arrival at Delhi, splendours of a Durbar at Jaipur, the spectacular Republic Day parade in Delhi, and visits to the Taj Mahal, Durgapur steelworks, the botanical gardens at Bangalore, and the cities of Calcutta, Madras, and the Holy city of Benares.

results.title: India and Pakistan: the lands and people
results.brief_description: The great subcontinent of India, comprising both Pakistan and the Union of India, is examined in terms of its four major geographic regions. The range in climate and land forms of these regions is seen to affect both crop production and population density. Life in cities, as well as in rural areas, is surveyed as an aid to understanding these key countries of Asia.

results.title: India's history: Mogul empire to european colonization
results.brief_description: Beginning with the rule of the Delhi Sultans in the 13th century, the film traces the subsequent growth of the powerful and enlightened empire of the Moguls, the decline of these rulers, the rise of European interest in India, and the conflict between Britain and France for control of Indian trade, culminating in the Battle of Plassey in 1760.

results.title: India's history: early civilization
results.brief_description: Exploring the basic influences that shaped the beginnings of India’s long and complex history, this survey recounts the early days of original inhabitants, of invasions, and of the rise of great leaders - Buddha, Chandragupta Maurya, and Asoka. The cultural contributions, notably Buddhism and Hinduism, made by successive peoples are seen to have their origins in early India.

results.title: India's history: British Colony to independence
results.brief_description: The centuries during which India’s people strove for independence, the role of the British East India Company, the realisation of independence, and the creation of Pakistan and the Union of India are examined. The film also presents the influence of Mohandas Gandhi, the changing relations between India and Britain, and the problems confronting India’s two great people - Hindus and Muslims.

results.title: Index to progress
results.creator_credit: Beechdale Educational Films and Walter F. Broome
results.brief_description: A survey of urban and rural library services in Great Britain. Shows the following various types of libraries and the services provided by each: Reference, Commercial, Technical and Children’s libraries and the local collection.

results.title: Independence Day USA
results.creator_credit: John G. Fuller and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Describes the various ways in which individual Americans celebrate their Independence Day, July 4th. They honour the heroes responsible for the Declaration of Independence and the national ideals of human rights embodied in it.
